poem:
Title: "Reflections on the Screen's Mirage"

In silver silence, a heron takes flight,
Through veil of grief – a boy's moonlit night.
Miyazaki's quill, still dipped in eldritch grace,
Sketches dreams across Time's enigmatic face.
Is the magic but a haunting refrain?
No, it alights anew - shimmers in the rain.
Prospero's broken staff, mended in light,
Echos of enchantment in celluloid's night.
